interestingFact: Tokyo is the most populous metropolitan area in the world.
Paris is often called 'The City of Light' because it was one of the first cities to have street lighting.
Brasilia was designed in the shape of an airplane and was built in just 41 months.
New Delhi is known for its rich history and is home to three UNESCO World Heritage sites.
Canberra was chosen as the capital as a compromise between Sydney and Melbourne.
Ottawa is home to the world's largest skating rink, the Rideau Canal.
Rome has an independent country within it: Vatican City, the smallest country in the world.
Cairo is known as 'The City of a Thousand Minarets' for its stunning Islamic architecture.
Pretoria is one of South Africaâ€™s three capitals and is known for its purple Jacaranda trees.
Berlin is home to the largest train station in Europe.
